laboratory_examinations.findings: 318 mMol/Mol creatinine (normal range <300 mMol/Mol creatinine), normal kidney function (creatinine 0.8 mg/dl)
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: At 7 days of age, urinary oxalate levels increased to 1,200 mMol/Mol. At 21 days, urinary oxalate concentrations started to reduce and reached normal value at 9 months.
Plasma oxalate levels were 10 µMol/L at 6 months and 6 µMol/L at 20 months.
GFR matured normally during the first year of life, presenting normal renal function from birth to the last follow-up.
